info.title: SpaceCat API
info.description:
The SpaceCat API is used to manage edge delivery site directory and obtain audit information.

## Authentication
<SecurityDefinitions></SecurityDefinitions>

tags.name: import
tags.description: APIs for importing content to Edge Delivery Services

tags.name: consent-banner
tags.description: APIs for taking and retrieving webpage screenshots, specifically for consent banner analysis

tags.description: Site URL tracking and management operations

get.summary: Retrieve all latest audits of a given type
get.description:
This endpoint is useful for retrieving all audits of a given type.
Optionally, the results can be sorted in ascending order by audited at date.

get.summary: Authenticate with Google
get.description:
This endpoint is used to authenticate with Google.
The user will be redirected to the Google authentication flow.

200.description: Successful operation and token has been saved

302.description: Redirect to Google authentication flow

404.description: Site matching site found in Google Search Console

get.description: This endpoint is used to check if a site is connected to Google Search Console and verify authentication status.

200.description: Site is successfully connected to Google Search Console

status.description: The GSC connection status of the site
status.example: Site is connected to Google Search Console

404.description: Authentication tokens not found or Site not found in Google Search Console

post.summary: Authenticate with access token
post.description: Authenticates a user using an IMS access token and returns session information.

accessToken.description: The access token to authenticate with

sessionToken.description: A JWT token signed by the service containing the user profile and tenants.

get.summary: Get the latest application configuration

patch.summary: Partially update configuration sections
patch.description:
Partially updates one or more sections of the configuration (handlers, jobs, queues).
This endpoint merges the provided data with existing configuration rather than replacing it.
Only the sections specified in the request body will be updated.
Creates a new version automatically.
Note: Version and slackRoles fields are excluded from updates.

handlers.description: Handlers configuration (merges with existing handlers - adds new, updates existing)

jobs.description: Jobs configuration (merges with existing jobs - updates matching jobs by type and group)

queues.description: Queue URLs configuration (merges with existing queues - updates only specified queue URLs)

put.summary: Update queue URLs in the configuration

audits.description: SQS queue URL for audit jobs

imports.description: SQS queue URL for import jobs

reports.description: SQS queue URL for report jobs

scrapes.description: SQS queue URL for scrape jobs

patch.summary: Update a job's schedule and properties

parameters.name: jobType
parameters.description: The type of job to update

patch.summary: Update a handler's properties

parameters.name: handlerType
parameters.description: The type of handler to update

enabledByDefault.description: Whether the handler is enabled by default for all sites

sites.description: Array of site IDs where handler is enabled

orgs.description: Array of organization IDs where handler is enabled

sites.description: Array of site IDs where handler is disabled

orgs.description: Array of organization IDs where handler is disabled

handler.description: Handler that must be enabled first

productCodes.description: Required product codes (must be non-empty if provided)

get.summary: Get a specific version of the application configuration

200.description: Specific version of the application configuration.

post.summary: Restore configuration to a specific version
post.description:
Restores the configuration to a specific version by creating a new version
with the data (handlers, jobs, queues, slackRoles) from the specified version.
This creates a new configuration version, preserving the complete version history.
Only administrators can restore configurations.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version identifier to restore from

restoredFrom.description: The version number that was restored from

message.description: Success message

post.summary: Register a new audit type in the configuration

auditType.description: The type of audit to register

enabledByDefault.description: Whether this audit type should be enabled by default for new sites

interval.description: The job interval for running the audit

items.description: The product codes the audit should be executed for

message.description: Success message including the audit type that was registered
message.example: Audit type "cwv" has been successfully registered

version.description: The new configuration version after registering

value.message: Audit type "cwv" has been successfully registered

delete.summary: Unregister an audit type from the configuration

parameters.name: auditType
parameters.description: The type of audit to unregister

message.description: Success message including the audit type that was unregistered
message.example: Audit type "cwv" has been successfully unregistered

version.description: The new configuration version after unregistering

value.message: Audit type "cwv" has been successfully unregistered

patch.summary: Enable or disable audits for sites or organizations
patch.description:
Use this endpoint to enable or disable specific audit types for your sites or entire organizations.
You can specify either a site (via baseURL) or an organization (via organizationId), but not both.

baseURL.description: Site URL (use this OR organizationId, not both)

organizationId.description: Organization ID (use this OR baseURL, not both)

auditType.description: The type of audit to be enabled or disabled.
examples: cwv
broken-backlinks

enable.description: Set to true to enable the audit, or false to disable it.

site-level.summary: Enable audit for a specific site

207.description: Multi-status response with results for each operation

404.description: Site, organization, or audit type not found

post.summary: Process fulfillment_completed events
post.description:
This endpoint can be used to process an array of fulfillment_completed
events, in the format produced by the Fulfillment Gateway and 
delivered by the Hoolihan pipeline. In particular, it is intended to 
be used to handle contract fulfillment events which involve an Edge 
Delivery Services fulfillable item "code".

post.summary: Process incoming site discovery hooks from CDN logs
post.description:
This endpoint processes hooks that include x-forwarded-host header value from CDN logs 
Upon receiving the incoming webhook, it initiates a sequence of validation and sanitization procedures
Once successful sanitization and validation are completed, 
it proceeds to send a Slack message notifying about the discovered domain

post.summary: Process incoming site discovery hooks from RUM logs
post.description:
This endpoint processes hooks that include URL and domain information from RUM logs 
Upon receiving the incoming webhook, it initiates a sequence of validation and sanitization procedures
Once successful sanitization and validation are completed, 
it proceeds to send a Slack message notifying about the discovered domain

post.summary: Process setup completed events for site integration with analytics
post.description:
Not implemented yet (will be via https://github.com/adobe/spacecat-api-service/issues/237).
Process setup completed events for site integration with analytics.

post.summary: Submit a new preflight async job
post.description:
This endpoint is useful for submitting a new preflight async job.
The job will process the provided URL and return the results.
The jobId can be used to poll for the status of the job.

urls.description: Array of URLs to be processed by the job

step.description: The audit step to be performed

checks.description: Optional array of specific checks to run. If not provided, all checks will be run.

400.description: Invalid request (missing urls array, step field, or other required fields)

get.summary: Get preflight job status and result
get.description:
This endpoint is used to retrieve the status and results of a preflight async job.
The jobId must be provided in the path parameter.
If the job is completed, the result will be included in the response.
If the job is still in progress, a 200 response will be returned.

post.summary: Create new Scrape Job
post.description:
**EXPERIMENTAL / PROTOTYPE**
This endpoint allows you to create a new async url scrape job.
The job is provided a list URLs to be scraped. The URLs are fed into a queue and processed 1 at a time.
The returned jobId can be used to poll for the status and the results of the job.

get.summary: Get Scrape Job Status
get.description:
**EXPERIMENTAL / PROTOTYPE**
This endpoint is used to retrieve the status of an async scrape job.
The jobId must be provided in the path parameter. (see samples)

get.summary: Get Scrape Job URL Results
get.description:
**EXPERIMENTAL / PROTOTYPE**
This endpoint is used to retrieve the results of an async scrape job.
The jobId must be provided in the path parameter. (see samples)

get.summary: Get Scrape Jobs by Date Range
get.description:
**EXPERIMENTAL / PROTOTYPE**
This endpoint is used to retrieve the scrape jobs by date range.
The startDate and endDate must be provided in the path parameter. (see samples)

get.summary: Get Scrape Jobs by Base URL
get.description:
**EXPERIMENTAL / PROTOTYPE**
This endpoint is used to retrieve the scrape jobs by base URL.
The baseURL must be provided in the path parameter. (see samples)

get.summary: Get Scrape Jobs by Base URL and Processing Type
get.description:
**EXPERIMENTAL / PROTOTYPE**
This endpoint is used to retrieve the scrape jobs by base URL.
The baseURL and processingType must be provided in the path parameter

get.summary: Get Scrape URLs by URL and Processing Type
get.description:
**EXPERIMENTAL / PROTOTYPE**
This endpoint is used to retrieve scraped URLs by a specific URL and processing type.
The URL and processingType must be provided in the path parameter. (see samples)
Returns an array of scrape URL results sorted by creation date (newest first).

post.summary: Take screenshots for consent banner analysis
post.description:
**EXPERIMENTAL / PROTOTYPE**

Creates a new scrape job specifically for taking consent banner screenshots.
This endpoint captures webpage screenshots in different states (with/without consent banners)
across different devices (desktop and mobile).

The job generates four distinct screenshot variants:
- Desktop with consent banner visible
- Desktop with consent banner dismissed/hidden
- Mobile with consent banner visible
- Mobile with consent banner dismissed/hidden

The returned jobId can be used with the GET /consent-banner endpoint to retrieve the results.

url.description: The URL of the webpage to capture screenshots from

force.description: Force a fresh scrape by bypassing cached results. When true, ignores any existing cached screenshots and captures new ones.

jobId.description: The ID of the screenshot job

status.description: The status of the screenshot job

message.description: A message describing the job status

value.message: Screenshot job has been queued for processing

400.description: Bad request - Invalid or missing URL

get.summary: Get consent banner screenshots
get.description:
**EXPERIMENTAL / PROTOTYPE**

Retrieves the results of a consent banner screenshot job. Returns pre-signed URLs
for accessing the generated screenshot images and associated scrape data.

The response includes four screenshot variants:
- `desktop_cookie_banner_on`: Desktop screenshot with consent banner visible
- `desktop_cookie_banner_off`: Desktop screenshot with consent banner hidden
- `mobile_cookie_banner_on`: Mobile screenshot with consent banner visible
- `mobile_cookie_banner_off`: Mobile screenshot with consent banner hidden

Additionally provides access to the raw scrape JSON data for further analysis.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: The ID of the screenshot job to retrieve results for

jobId.description: The ID of the completed screenshot job

results.description: Collection of screenshot URLs and scrape data

desktop_cookie_banner_on.description: Pre-signed URL for desktop screenshot with consent banner

desktop_cookie_banner_off.description: Pre-signed URL for desktop screenshot without consent banner

mobile_cookie_banner_on.description: Pre-signed URL for mobile screenshot with consent banner

mobile_cookie_banner_off.description: Pre-signed URL for mobile screenshot without consent banner

screenshotTime.description: Time taken to capture this screenshot in milliseconds

dimensionsDevice.description: Device type used for the scrape

scrapeTime.description: Total time for the scrape process in milliseconds

dimensions.description: Dimensional analysis results from the consent banner detection, organized by device type

bannerSelector.description: CSS selector used to identify the consent banner

overlaySelector.description: CSS selector used to identify the overlay element

wrapperSelector.description: CSS selector used to identify the wrapper element

400.description: Bad request - Missing or invalid jobId

404.description: Screenshot job not found or still processing

value.error: Scrape job is still running. Try again in a few secs.

500.description: Internal server error or job failed

get.summary: Resolve site and organization data
get.description:
This endpoint resolves site and organization data based on flexible query parameters.
It supports resolution by organization ID, IMS organization ID, or specific site ID.
The endpoint validates entitlements and enrollments for the specified product code.

**Resolution Logic:**
1. If `siteId` is provided, validates the site against the organization
2. Otherwise, resolves by `organizationId` or `imsOrg`
3. Returns the first enrolled site with matching entitlement

parameters.name: organizationId
parameters.description: UUID of the organization (mutually exclusive with imsOrg)

parameters.name: imsOrg
parameters.description: IMS Organization ID (mutually exclusive with organizationId)

parameters.name: siteId
parameters.description: UUID of a specific site to validate against the organization

200.description: Successfully resolved site and organization data

400.description: Bad request - missing required parameters or invalid input

value.message: Product code required in x-product header
Either organizationId or imsOrg must be provided

404.description: Not found - no site found for the provided parameters

example.message: No site found for the provided parameters

get.summary: Retrieve a single site by its Base URL
get.description:
This endpoint is useful for retrieving a site when you only have its Base URL. The Base URL is a unique identifier for a site other than the Site ID.
The base URL provided in the path must be base64 encoded. This is to allow for URLs with special characters to be used as path parameters.

get.summary: Get latest site metrics
get.description:
Retrieves the latest metrics for a specific site, including RUM (Real User Monitoring)
data and organic traffic metrics. Returns zeroed values if no data is available or
no RUM domain key is configured.

pageViewsChange.description: Percentage change in page views compared to the previous period (last 30 days vs prior 30 days)

ctrChange.description: Percentage change in Click-Through Rate (CTR) compared to the previous period

projectedTrafficValue.description: Projected traffic value based on page views change and cost per click

currentPageViews.description: Total page views for the current period (last 30 days)

previousPageViews.description: Total page views for the previous period (prior 30 days)

currentLCP.description: Current Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) metric in milliseconds for the last 30 days

previousLCP.description: Previous Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) metric in milliseconds for the prior 30 days

currentEngagement.description: Current engagement metric for the last 30 days

previousEngagement.description: Previous engagement metric for the prior 30 days

currentConversion.description: Current conversion (total clicks) for the last 30 days

previousConversion.description: Previous conversion (total clicks) for the prior 30 days

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The handler type of content to list (either 'scrapes' or 'imports').

parameters.name: path
parameters.description:
Optional path prefix to filter the recursive file search (e.g., 'about-us/' or 'docx/').
If not specified, the search begins from the root directory of the specified type.

parameters.name: rootOnly
parameters.description:
When set to true, returns only files directly under the specified prefix, excluding subdirectories.
When false or omitted, includes all files recursively within subdirectories.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Number of items to return per page. Default is 100, maximum is 1000.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Pagination token obtained from the previous response's nextPageToken field.

get.summary: List all files for a site and type
get.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of files for the specified site and handler type (scrapes or imports).
The search can be filtered by path prefix and can include or exclude subdirectories.

Features:
- Path filtering: Start the search from a specific subdirectory
- Root-level filtering: Option to retrieve only root-level files
- Pagination: Control the number of results per page and navigate through results

Each file entry includes:
- A unique key (full path relative to the content type root)
- File name
- File metadata (size and last modified timestamp)

200.description: Successfully retrieved the list of files

nextPageToken.description: Token for retrieving the next page of results, if available.

get.summary: Get a file by its storage key
get.description:
Returns a pre-signed URL for accessing a file stored in S3.
- Can be used to download or view the file content

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The S3 object key (file path) of the file to retrieve

302.description: Redirect to pre-signed URL for file access

Location.description: Pre-signed URL for accessing the file

and in descending order by traffic within these buckets.

and in descending order by traffic within these buckets.

get.summary: Retrieve top pages for site by source and geo

The top pages will be ordered in descending order by traffic.

parameters.name: byCustomer
parameters.description: Filter by customer-added (true) or system-added (false) URLs. Defaults to true.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to return per page

get.summary: List URLs for a site
get.description:
Retrieves URLs stored for a site with pagination support.
By default, returns customer-added URLs (byCustomer=true).
Pass byCustomer=false to get system-added URLs.
URLs are returned in batches with a cursor for fetching the next page.

200.description: A paginated list of audit URLs

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to return per page

get.description:

Results are paginated.

200.description: A paginated list of audit URLs with the specified audit enabled

parameters.name: base64Url
parameters.description: URL-safe base64 encoded URL without padding (RFC 4648 5)

get.summary: Get a specific URL
get.description:
Retrieves a specific URL by its base64-encoded representation.
The URL must be encoded using URL-safe base64 without padding (RFC 4648 5).

post.summary: Add URLs (bulk operation)
post.description:
Adds one or more URLs to the URL store. This operation is idempotent - 
if a URL already exists, it will be updated.

- Maximum 100 URLs per request
- URLs are canonicalized before storage
- Duplicate detection based on canonicalized URL
- Returns per-item success/failure information

patch.summary: Update audit configurations (bulk operation)
patch.description:
Updates the audit configurations for one or more URLs.
Only the audits array is updated, completely overriding the existing value.

- Maximum 100 URLs per request
- Works for URLs from any source
- Returns per-item success/failure information

delete.description:
Removes one or more URLs from the URL store.

- Maximum 100 URLs per request
- **Constraint**: Only customer-added URLs (byCustomer: true) can be deleted
- Returns per-item success/failure information

get.summary: Get top pages by paid traffic source for a site
get.description: Returns the top pages per traffic source receiving the most paid traffic for a given week.

get.summary: Get paid traffic data grouped by URL and page type
get.description: Returns paid traffic data for a site, grouped by URL and page type for a given week or month and year.

302.description: Redirect to signed S3 URL containing the result data as a JSON array matching the PaidTrafficUrlPageTypeData schema (see schema definition below).

Location.description: The signed S3 URL where the result data can be downloaded

get.summary: Get paid traffic data grouped by URL, page type, platform, campaign, and device

get.summary: Retrieve site metrics by source
get.description: This endpoint is useful for retrieving site metrics by source.

get.summary: Retrieve page metrics by source
get.description:
This endpoint is useful for retrieving page metrics by source.
Currently only `organic-keywords` is supported as a metric and only for source `ahrefs`.

get.summary: Retrieves all experiments for the site
get.description: This endpoint provide a list of experiments obtained from RUM data for the given site along with all the experiment details.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all fixes for a specific opportunity

post.summary: Create and add a list of one or more fixes to an opportunity in one transaction
post.description:
Creates one or more fix entities for a given opportunity. Each fix can optionally include 
an array of suggestionIds to associate existing suggestions with the fix. This allows you 
to link fixes to the suggestions they address in a single transaction.

207.description:
A list of fixes created and added to the opportunity,
or the status code and error message for the ones failed.

get.summary: Retrieve fixes for a specific opportunity filtered by status

200.description: A list of fixes filtered by status

get.summary: Retrieve details of a specific fix

patch.summary: Update specific attributes of an existing fix
patch.description:
Updates one or more attributes of an existing fix. This includes the ability to update 
the suggestionIds array to associate or reassociate suggestions with the fix. When updating 
suggestionIds, the new array replaces any existing associations.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of all suggestions for a specific fix

patch.summary: Update the status of one or multiple fixes in one transaction

207.description:
A list of fixes updated,
or the status code and error message for the ones failed.

post.summary: Request invitation to an existing Slack channel of an organization
post.description:
This endpoint can be used to invite a user to their organization's Slack 
channel by IMS user ID, which is read from the IMS API via the provided 
user access token. As a prerequisite, there must be an existing Spacecat 
organization and Slack channel for the given IMS org ID.

202.description: Request accepted, invite(s) to follow by email if successful

get.summary: Trigger an audit
get.description:
**Warning:** This API is deprecated, will be removed in future versions and should no longer be used or enhanced.
Please use the Slack commands to trigger audits on-demand.

This endpoint is useful for triggering an audit.
The audit will be run asynchronously and the response will be returned immediately.

The audit type is determined by the type parameter and must be one of the following:
  - 404
  - apex
  - cwv
  - lhs
  - lhs-desktop
  - lhs-mobile

The URL can be either a site ID or a base URL depending on the audit type.

post.summary: Create a new API key
post.description:
This endpoint can be used to create a new API key with a set of scopes. The scoped API key will be
returned in the response only once. The scoped API key can be used to authenticate the Spacecat APIs by
including it in the x-api-key header.

parameters.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
parameters.description: IMS Organization Id of the client.

get.summary: Get all API keys owned by the given IMS client
get.description: This endpoint can be used to list all the API keys created by the client.

parameters.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
parameters.description: IMS Organization Id of the client.

200.description: API key metadata returned successfully. Note that the API key itself will not be included in this list, as it's only displayed once (at creation).

delete.description:
This endpoint can be used to delete an API key. The API key will be marked as deleted in the system and
will no longer be valid for authentication. Only keys created by this IMS client can be deleted by it.

parameters.name: x-gw-ims-org-id
parameters.description: IMS Organization Id of the client.

post.summary: Create a new import job
post.description:
This endpoint starts a new import job with a set of URLs, an import API key, an optional import.js 
mapping file, and optional custom headers. The job runs asynchronously, and its status can be 
queried at /tools/import/jobs/{jobId}.

If no import queue is available when the request is made, the endpoint returns a 503 Service 
Unavailable response. Each client is allowed only one active import job; additional requests 
will receive a 429 Too Many Requests response.

An import job may include a type, specifying the kind of job to create. The available options 
are 'doc', 'da' and 'xwalk', with 'doc' as the default if no type is provided.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description:
Client-specific import API key. This same key will be required to fetch the job status, 
and final .zip result.

get.summary: Query the status of an import job
get.description: This endpoint can be used to query the status of an import job, given its jobId.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Client-specific import API key. Must match the key used to start the import job.

200.description: Successful operation with an import status object returned.

delete.description:
This endpoint can be used to delete an import job, given its jobId. This operation will remove
all import URL entities in addition to the import job itself. The `imports.delete` scope is 
required on the API key used to delete the import job, and only jobs created by the provided
key can be deleted.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description:
Client-specific import API key. Must match the key used to start the import job, and
include the imports.delete scope.

patch.summary: Patch an import job
patch.description:
This endpoint can be used to stop an import job, given its jobId. This operation will prevent
any further scraping of the import job URLs, and mark the job status as STOPPED. The results
will not be saved to storage, allowing the user to start a new import immediately.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description:
Client-specific import API key. Must match the key used to start the import job, and
include the imports.write scope.

get.summary: Query the progress of an import job
get.description: This endpoint can be used to query the progress of an import job, given its jobId.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Client-specific import API key. Must match the key used to start the import job.

200.description: The current progress of the import job.

post.summary: Request a pre-signed URL to download the result of an import job as a .zip archive
post.description:
This endpoint can be used to download an archive of an import job, which will include
all the resulting documents that were generated as part of the import. It will also 
include the import-report.xlsx file, which contains a summary of the import job.

parameters.name: x-api-key
parameters.description: Client-specific import API key. Must match the key used to start the import job.

200.description: Successful operation with an import archive delivered to the client.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: One or more file paths to fetch (comma-separated or multiple query params). Used for multi-file mode when no path parameters are provided.

parameters.name: filter.*
parameters.description: Filter results by field values (e.g., filter.status=active, filter.category=cat1). Multiple filters are ANDed together with case-insensitive exact matching.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort results by field in ascending or descending order (format - field:asc or field:desc)

parameters.name: sheets
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of sheet names to include (for multi-sheet data)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return

parameters.name: sheet
parameters.description: Specific sheet name to fetch from the data source

get.summary: Query LLMO data files with filters and sorting
get.description:
Retrieves and processes data from the external LLMO data endpoint with advanced querying capabilities via URL parameters.
This endpoint supports two modes:

**Multi-file mode**: Use the `file` query parameter to fetch multiple files at once (up to 7 concurrent requests).
Each file is processed independently and returned in a results array.

**Single-file mode**: The endpoint will look for dataSource in the path and fetch that specific file.

Query parameters allow filtering, field inclusion, sorting, and sheet selection. This is an optimized
alternative to the POST endpoints that uses GET requests with URL parameters for caching and simplicity.

200.description: LLMO data queried and processed successfully

oneOf.description: Single file response with processed data
Multi-file response with array of results

path.description: The file path that was fetched

status.description: The status of the fetch operation

data.description: The processed data (only present if status is success)

error.description: Error message (only present if status is error)

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: The data source identifier to fetch from the external endpoint

parameters.name: filter.*
parameters.description: Filter results by field values (e.g., filter.status=active)

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort results by field (format - field:asc or field:desc)

parameters.name: sheets
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of sheet names to include

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return

parameters.name: sheet
parameters.description: Specific sheet name to fetch from the data source

get.summary: Query LLMO data for a specific data source
get.description:
Retrieves and processes data from a specific data source file with query parameters for filtering,
field inclusion, sorting, and sheet selection. The data is fetched from {dataFolder}/{dataSource}.

parameters.name: dataSource
parameters.description: The data source identifier to fetch from the external endpoint

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include

parameters.name: sheets
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of sheet names to include

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of records to return

get.summary: Query LLMO data with sheet type
get.description:
Retrieves and processes data with a specified sheet type. The data is fetched from
{dataFolder}/{sheetType}/{dataSource}. Supports query parameters for filtering, sorting, and field selection.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to include

This endpoint allows filtering data with case-insensitive exact matching, excluding specific fields from the response,
and grouping data by specified attributes. The endpoint fetches all available data (up to 1M records) to apply
the query operations effectively.

get.summary: Get LLMO configuration
get.description:
Retrieves the LLMO (Large Language Model Optimizer) configuration for a specific site.
This endpoint retrieves the configuration directly from S3 storage. The configuration
includes entities (categories, topics), brand aliases, and competitor information.
Categories may include optional URLs for content matching.

If a version parameter is provided, the specific version of the configuration will be
retrieved. If the version does not exist, a 404 error will be returned. If no version
is provided, the latest version will be returned, or a default configuration if none
exists.

version.description: The S3 object version ID of the configuration, or null if default configuration is returned

post.summary: Update LLMO configuration
post.description:
Updates the LLMO (Large Language Model Optimizer) configuration for a specific site.
This operation completely overwrites the existing configuration with the provided payload.
The payload is validated against the LLMO configuration schema before being stored in S3.
The configuration must include entities, brands, and competitors sections.

Categories can optionally include URLs that can be either exact URLs or URL prefixes
(ending with /*) to match against specific content areas.

version.description: The S3 object version ID of the updated configuration

get.summary: Get LLMO questions
get.description:
Retrieves all LLMO questions (both human and AI) for a specific site.
Returns an object with Human and AI question arrays.

post.summary: Add LLMO questions
post.description:
Adds new questions to the LLMO configuration for a specific site.
Questions can be added to both Human and AI categories.

parameters.name: questionKey
parameters.description: The unique key of the question to modify

delete.description:
Removes a specific question from the LLMO configuration by its unique key.
The question can be from either Human or AI categories.

patch.summary: Update LLMO question
patch.description:
Updates a specific question in the LLMO configuration by its unique key.
The question can be from either Human or AI categories.

get.summary: Get LLMO customer intent
get.description:
Retrieves all LLMO customer intent key-value pairs for a specific site.
Returns an array of customer intent items with key and value properties.

post.summary: Add LLMO customer intent
post.description:
Adds new customer intent items to the LLMO configuration for a specific site.
Customer intent items are key-value pairs that define customer targeting and goals.

parameters.name: intentKey
parameters.description: The unique key of the customer intent item to modify

delete.description:
Removes a specific customer intent item from the LLMO configuration by its key.
The key should match an existing customer intent item.

200.description: LLMO customer intent item removed successfully

patch.summary: Update LLMO customer intent item
patch.description:
Updates a specific customer intent item in the LLMO configuration by its key.
You can update either the key, value, or both properties.

200.description: LLMO customer intent item updated successfully

patch.summary: Update LLMO CDN logs filter configuration
patch.description: Updates the CDN logs filter configuration for a specific site.

200.description: LLMO CDN logs filter updated successfully

post.description:
Triggers one or more audits for a sandbox site. If no specific audit types are provided,
all enabled audits will be triggered. Rate limiting is applied to prevent excessive audit runs.

post.summary: Onboard new customer to LLMO
post.description:
Onboards a net new customer to LLMO (Large Language Model Optimizer).
This endpoint handles the complete onboarding process including organization validation,
site creation/validation, LLMO configuration setup, and initial analysis trigger.
The IMS Organization ID is automatically extracted from the user's JWT token (sub property).

post.summary: Offboard customer from LLMO
post.description:
Offboards a customer from LLMO (Large Language Model Optimizer).
This endpoint handles disabling audits and cleaning up LLMO configuration for a site.
The site must have LLMO enabled and the user must have appropriate permissions.

message.description: Success message

siteId.description: The site ID that was offboarded

status.description: The offboarding status

post.summary: Get optimization report graph data
post.description:
Retrieves time-series graph data for optimization reports based on Real User Monitoring (RUM) metrics.
This endpoint queries the RUM API to fetch performance metrics over a specified time range for one or more URLs.

The data is aggregated according to the specified granularity (e.g., daily, weekly) and can be used to
visualize performance trends and patterns for optimization reports.

**Use Cases:**
- Displaying performance trends over time in optimization reports
- Comparing metrics across multiple pages
- Analyzing performance changes within specific date ranges

Supported audit types for sandbox environments:
- meta-tags: General meta tag analysis for all page types
- product-metatags: Specialized audit for Product Detail Pages (PDP) of commerce sites,

- alt-text: Alternative text analysis for images

Comma-separated list of audit types:
- meta-tags: General meta tag analysis
- product-metatags: PDP-focused audit for e-commerce sites (scrapes SKU, thumbnail, catalog/store view codes)
- alt-text: Image alternative text analysis
